sn48.9:4.3: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom.
sn48.9:4.5: And what is the faculty of faith?
sn48.9:4.6: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
sn48.9:4.7: ‘That Blessed One is perfect, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
sn48.9:4.8: This is called the faculty of faith.
sn48.9:5.1: And what is the faculty of energy?
sn48.9:5.2: It’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unwholesome qualities and gaining wholesome qualities. They’re strong, firmly applied, not slacking off when it comes to developing wholesome qualities.
sn48.9:5.3: This is called the faculty of energy.
sn48.9:6.1: And what is the faculty of mindfulness?
sn48.9:6.2: It’s when a noble disciple is mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
sn48.9:6.3: This is called the faculty of mindfulness.
sn48.9:7.1: And what is the faculty of samādhi?
sn48.9:7.2: It’s when a noble disciple, relying on letting go, gets samādhi, gets unification of mind.
sn48.9:7.3: This is called the faculty of samādhi.
sn48.9:8.1: And what is the faculty of wisdom?
sn48.9:8.2: It’s when a noble disciple is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
sn48.9:8.3: This is called the faculty of wisdom.
